nodes.speaker: Merchant Keth
nodes.text: Welcome, traveler! I've got supplies from across the Saltglass Steppe. What brings you to my humble stall?

options.text: I'd like to see your wares.
options.response: Of course! Take a look at what I have available.

options.text: Tell me about the local area.
How do you feel about the other factions?
I need to go.
options.response: Safe travels, friend. May the salt winds guide you.

nodes.speaker: Merchant Keth
nodes.text: This area's been getting more dangerous lately. Glass spiders have been spotted near the old ruins, and the storms are getting stronger. You'd best be careful out there.

options.text: Any advice for dealing with glass spiders?
options.response: Keep your distance and use ranged attacks if you can. Their webs are sharp as razors, but they're fragile creatures.

options.text: What about the storms?
options.response: The Storm Prophets say they're signs of change coming. I just know they make travel treacherous. Stock up on supplies before venturing far.

options.text: Thanks for the warning.

nodes.speaker: Merchant Keth
nodes.text: Well, since you've proven yourself trustworthy... The Glasswright Guild makes fine tools, but they're prideful. The Storm Prophets speak in riddles, but their warnings often prove true. We Saltborn just try to survive and help each other.

options.text: I respect that philosophy.
options.response: Good to hear! Here, take this as a token of friendship.

options.text: What about trade between factions?
options.response: Trade keeps us all alive, regardless of politics. Though some are more... selective about their customers.

nodes.speaker: Artisan Vex
nodes.text: Ah, another seeker of fine craftsmanship. The Glasswright Guild's reputation precedes us, I trust?

options.text: I'm interested in your glass work.
options.response: Excellent! Our pieces are unmatched in quality and precision.

options.text: I've heard you only sell to guild members.
Can you teach me about glassworking?
I should be going.
options.response: Very well. Remember, true artistry cannot be rushed.

nodes.speaker: Artisan Vex
nodes.text: Our finest pieces are indeed reserved for those who understand their true value. Prove your dedication to the craft, and perhaps we can discuss exclusive arrangements.

options.text: How can I prove my dedication?
options.response: Bring me rare materials, support our guild's interests, and show respect for the ancient techniques. Reputation is earned, not bought.

options.text: That seems unfair.
options.response: Fairness? Quality craftsmanship requires standards. Perhaps you'd be more comfortable with... lesser merchants.

nodes.speaker: Artisan Vex
nodes.text: Ah, a true student of the craft! The secrets of glassworking are passed down through generations. The key is understanding that glass is not merely melted sand - it's crystallized potential.

options.text: Tell me about the advanced techniques.
options.response: The master techniques involve working with storm-touched glass and incorporating salt crystal matrices. Here, take these tools - you've earned them.

options.text: I'm grateful for the knowledge.
options.response: Knowledge shared is knowledge multiplied. Continue your studies, and the guild will take notice.

nodes.speaker: Prophet Zara
nodes.text: The winds whisper of your approach, wanderer. The storms have shown me glimpses of your path. What do you seek in these shifting times?

options.text: I seek items touched by the storm.
options.response: The storm provides for those who understand its nature. Behold what the winds have brought.

options.text: What do the storms tell you?
I don't believe in prophecies.
options.response: Belief is not required for truth to manifest. The storms care not for skepticism.

options.text: The storms guide my path as well.

nodes.speaker: Prophet Zara
nodes.text: The great convergence approaches. Glass and salt, storm and stillness - all will be tested. Those who adapt will endure, those who resist will be swept away like dust before the tempest.

options.text: What must I do to prepare?
options.response: Embrace change, gather allies, and trust in the storm's wisdom. Here, take this - you will need it when the time comes.

options.text: When will this convergence occur?
options.response: Time flows like sand through glass. Soon, but not yet. The signs will be unmistakable when the moment arrives.

nodes.speaker: Prophet Zara
nodes.text: Yes... I sense the storm's touch upon you. You understand what others cannot - that change is not to be feared, but embraced. The winds have marked you as one of us.

options.text: I am honored by the recognition.
options.response: Honor is earned through understanding. You have walked the path of transformation and emerged stronger. The storm smiles upon you.

options.text: What secrets can you share with me?
options.response: The deepest mysteries are not spoken, but experienced. Take this storm glass - it will reveal truths when the time is right.

nodes.speaker: Scribe Cornelius
nodes.text: Ah, another subject for documentation! Please state your name, occupation, and the exact time you first experienced existential dread.

options.text: I just wanted to say hello.
options.response: Hello is insufficient data! I need your full biographical details, including childhood pets and favorite geometric shapes.

options.text: What are you documenting?
options.response: Everything! The angle of dust motes, the frequency of sighs, the precise color of despair. Science demands completeness!

options.text: This seems excessive.
options.response: Excessive? My dear fellow, I haven't even started on the advanced documentation protocols! Wait until you see my charts on 'Emotional Weather Patterns.'

nodes.speaker: Scribe Cornelius
nodes.text: Excellent! Now, have you experienced any transformations? Please describe them in detail, including sensory data and philosophical implications.

options.text: I'd rather not.
options.response: Understandable! Privacy is important. I'll just note 'Subject exhibits documentation resistance syndrome.' Very common, actually.

options.text: Sure, I can help with your research.
options.response: Marvelous! Here's a 47-page questionnaire. Please fill it out in triplicate. The monastery's future depends on accurate record-keeping!

nodes.speaker: Scribe Cornelius
nodes.text: You see, future generations will need to understand exactly how we lived, thought, and occasionally panicked during the transformation period.

options.text: That's... actually quite thoughtful.
options.response: Precisely! Though I admit the section on 'Catalog of Worried Facial Expressions' may be overly detailed. I'm up to 247 distinct variations.
